channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: 19 inmates, 1 staff in women's prison infected with COVID-19
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: “19 Covid-19 positive out of 51 persons tested,” BuCor said.

item.title: Returning OFWs now required to take COVID-19 rapid tests
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The measure approved by the task force on Monday will apply to both land-based and sea-based migrant workers who will arrive in the Philippines.

item.title: Schools opening may be moved to August, DepEd chief Briones says
item.description: “The leaning is towards August 4 opening,” Education chief Leonor Briones said.

item.title: Trump offers additional assistance to Duterte
item.author: Patricia Lourdes Viray
item.description: The US Embassy said Trump expressed his solidarity with Duterte as both countries deal with the pandemic that has infected more than 2.4 million people in 193 countries and territories.

item.title: Environmental advocates urge leaders to put nature on top of agenda
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: In an open letter ahead of the Earth Day, 300 environmentalists urged the country’s leaders to address biodiversity loss, climate change and ecological amnesia.

item.title: Philippines should protest China’s new moves in South China Sea – Del Rosario
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: The government should protest China’s establishment of two new districts to govern the Paracels and Spratlys in the South China Sea, former foreign affairs chief Albert del Rosario said yesterday.

item.title: Quarantine helping flatten COVID-19 curve – expert
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The enhanced community quarantine, in force since March 17, may have flattened the curve of coronavirus disease 2019 infection, according to an infectious disease expert from the University of the Philippines-National Institutes of Health

item.title: Pag-IBIG OKs cash loans of over 37,000 members
item.author: Elizabeth Marcelo
item.description: The Home Development Mutual Fund or Pag-IBIG Fund has so far approved the cash loans of 37,901 members affected by the enhanced community quarantine due to the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: DILG tells LGUs: Stop market window hours
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: The Department of the Interior and Local Government has again reminded local government units not to impose limited window hours for residents to go to the markets and groceries that result in congestion in public places and violation of quarantine protocols.

item.title: No decision yet on ceasefire with Reds
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: There are growing calls for the government to end the ceasefire with communists because the rebels continue to commit atrocities even when Luzon is under enhanced community quarantine, Malacañang said yesterday.
